links.title: New 100K Challenge Is Starting Soon. Are You In?
links.description: Let the challenge begin. I was given a challenge and accepted it. The challenge is actually simple; turn a 3k options account into 100k. A few sites have done this. The guys over at traderminute run a challenge. Looks like the last challenge they took $3,000 and lost $2,388 while charging their members $599/month to follow along.

links.title: The Week In Rail: Carloads For The Big 6
links.description: As the week meandered to a close, a peek at performance by transportation stocks paints a mixed picture of the economy. Transportation metrics such as freight volumes are considered leading indicators of economic activity. Does the mixed message relayed by freight volumes contradicts the Fed's assessment of a vibrant economy?

links.title: Tesla vs. Mercedes: The battle for customer loyalty
links.description: A showdown between Tesla Motors [NASDAQ: TSLA] and Mercedes-Benz surfaced in CIO Magazine* recently, pitting the two automakers against one another to see who wins the battle for customer loyalty. Former research fellow at Forrester, Rob Enderle compares the two companies and finds that even though, "Mercedes Benz is arguably the oldest car company at scale and Tesla is the newest.

messages.body: $TSLA https://electrek.co/2016/09/25/tesla-gigafactory-aerial-shots-september-2016-update/

links.title: Tesla Gigafactory: new aerial shots show plant more than doubling in size [September 2016 update]
links.description: Back in July, Tesla officially inaugurated the first phase of its Gigafactory in Nevada - the first 4 sections of the building seen above. Now new aerial pictures show that the automaker is already well on its way to bring up the structures for 4 more sections to more than double the size of the already massive plant.

links.title: SpaceX Figured Out Why Its Expensive Rocket Exploded
links.description: Earlier this month, we watched a SpaceX rocket-fully loaded with its satellite-explode suddenly and inexplicably. At the time, the cause remained a mystery, but now SpaceX's engineers have traced the flaw to its source. SpaceX has released the initial results of its investigation, which reveal that it believes a breach in the helium system in the Falcon 9's liquid oxygen system caused the sudden flare up.
